thread.title: ETF Trader: China gives bulls a plate of worry
thread.title_full: ETF Trader: China gives bulls a plate of worry

title: ETF Trader: China gives bulls a plate of worry
text:
Editor of The ETF Trader Free Preview 
For full access, Log in or Subscribe Now and get 4 weeks free! 
This week, we were met with the unexpected event of China devaluing its currency. Caught off guard, the global markets sold off — Europe more so than the U.S., and Japan less than either. But if China thought it was going to gain a long-lasting currency advantage, it was soon disabused of that notion. 
China was hoping to make its goods and services more price-attractive to its domestic consumers, and to make its exports more attractive to consumers around the globe. The move roiled the European markets, since their companies tend to have more trade exposure to China than ours, but even our own market sold off some. I’d argue this was more due to the suddenness and the near-term uncertainty concerning China’s plans to devalue its currency than any lasting issue, save for the fact that China is facing its homegrown version of a house of cards. That means we’ll need to rule in more panic-like moves on their part. To continue reading, please subscribe. Already a Subscriber? Log in
